speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Britain. The Roman camp.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Enter POSTHUMUS, with a bloody handkerchief

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Yea, bloody cloth, I'll keep thee, for I wish'd

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Thou shouldst be colour'd thus. You married ones,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: If each of you should take this course, how many

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Must murder wives much better than themselves

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: For wrying but a little! O Pisanio!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Every good servant does not all commands:

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: No bond but to do just ones. Gods! if you

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Should have ta'en vengeance on my faults, I never

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Had lived to put on this: so had you saved

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The noble Imogen to repent, and struck

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Me, wretch more worth your vengeance. But, alack,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You snatch some hence for little faults; that's love,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To have them fall no more: you some permit

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To second ills with ills, each elder worse,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And make them dread it, to the doers' thrift.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: But Imogen is your own: do your best wills,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And make me blest to obey! I am brought hither

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Among the Italian gentry, and to fight

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Against my lady's kingdom: 'tis enough

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: That, Britain, I have kill'd thy mistress; peace!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I'll give no wound to thee. Therefore, good heavens,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Hear patiently my purpose: I'll disrobe me

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Of these Italian weeds and suit myself

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: As does a Briton peasant: so I'll fight

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Against the part I come with; so I'll die

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: For thee, O Imogen, even for whom my life

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Is every breath a death; and thus, unknown,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Pitied nor hated, to the face of peril

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Myself I'll dedicate. Let me make men know

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: More valour in me than my habits show.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Gods, put the strength o' the Leonati in me!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To shame the guise o' the world, I will begin

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The fashion, less without and more within.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Exit
